name: Ace of Cups
description: A divine hand emerges from a cloud, offering a chalice overflowing with five streams of water. Beneath, lilies float on a tranquil pool. The dove descending symbolizes divine love and spiritual grace overflowing into emotional fulfillment.

name: Two of Cups
description: A young man and woman exchange cups beneath the caduceus of Hermes crowned by a lionâ€™s head, representing passionate yet balanced union. The card depicts the harmony of two souls connecting in love or mutual respect.

name: Three of Cups
description: Three maidens dance in a circle, raising their cups high amid fruit and flowers. The imagery speaks of emotional abundance, sisterhood, and the joy of shared success and connection.

name: Four of Cups
description: A man sits under a tree, gazing at three cups before him while a fourth is offered from a cloud. His crossed arms and downcast expression suggest boredom and emotional stagnation, yet unseen blessings hover within reach.

name: Five of Cups
description: A cloaked figure mourns over three spilled cups while two remain upright behind him. The river and bridge in the distance symbolize the potential to move past sorrow toward renewal, if only he turns to see it.

name: Six of Cups
description: Two children exchange flower-filled cups in a sunlit courtyard. The scene evokes innocence, simple joy, and the comforting pull of the past. It invites reflection on heartfelt memories and acts of giving.

name: Seven of Cups
description: A silhouetted figure faces seven floating cups filled with fantastical visionsâ€”jewels, serpents, castles, and more. The imagery reflects imagination and possibility but warns against confusion and wishful thinking.

name: Eight of Cups
description: A traveler leaves behind eight neatly stacked cups under the moonâ€™s light. The barren landscape and his journey upward symbolize turning away from comfort to seek deeper meaning and emotional clarity.

name: Nine of Cups
description: A well-dressed man sits proudly before nine golden cups arranged like trophies. The scene exudes emotional fulfillment and material comfortâ€”known as the 'wish card,' it signifies earned joy and self-satisfaction.

name: Ten of Cups
description: A couple stands arm in arm as children play beneath a radiant rainbow of cups. The idyllic landscape symbolizes unity, emotional security, and lasting happiness in relationships and community.

name: Page of Cups
description: A youthful figure gazes with surprise at a fish emerging from his cup. The playful scene represents intuition, imagination, and the arrival of emotional or artistic insight.

name: Knight of Cups
description: A knight rides a white horse, holding a golden cup aloft as if offering love or peace. His slow, deliberate pace embodies emotional depth, sensitivity, and the pursuit of beauty or connection.

name: Queen of Cups
description: A serene queen gazes into a lidded cup engraved with angels, seated by the sea. She represents inner reflection, emotional wisdom, and deep intuitive understanding of the heart.

name: King of Cups
description: The king sits upon a stone throne floating on turbulent waters, holding a cup and scepter. Despite the motion around him, he remains calmâ€”symbolizing mastery over emotions and steady leadership.

name: Ace of Cups Reversed
description: The overflowing cup now spills its waters downward, symbolizing emotional drain or love withheld. The imagery warns of blocked feelings or unexpressed affection needing release.

name: Two of Cups Reversed
description: The united pair now drift apart, their cups overturned. The reversed caduceus symbolizes conflict and disconnection between hearts once aligned.

name: Three of Cups Reversed
description: The joyful trioâ€™s celebration tips into excess. Cups spill as indulgence or rivalry replaces harmony, reflecting emotional imbalance in social or romantic circles.

name: Four of Cups Reversed
description: The figure stirs from apathy, finally noticing the cup once ignored. The reversed image speaks of re-engagement with life and openness to new emotional experiences.

name: Five of Cups Reversed
description: The cloaked figure turns toward the two standing cups, recognizing hope beyond loss. The reversed card symbolizes healing, renewed optimism, and reconnection.

name: Six of Cups Reversed
description: The childrenâ€™s exchange of flowers fades, reminding us to release nostalgia and face the present. The reversal signals emotional maturity and readiness for change.

name: Seven of Cups Reversed
description: The swirling visions vanish, leaving clear choices. The reversed card represents grounded decision-making and cutting through illusion to see what truly matters.

name: Eight of Cups Reversed
description: The wanderer hesitates or retraces his steps, reluctant to move forward. This reversal warns against staying in unfulfilling situations out of fear or nostalgia.

name: Nine of Cups Reversed
description: The proud manâ€™s cups topple, revealing hollow contentment. The reversal cautions against smugness or indulgence that masks deeper emotional emptiness.

name: Ten of Cups Reversed
description: The rainbow of unity dims and inverts, symbolizing emotional rifts or unrealistic expectations. The card warns of strained relationships and the need for honest reconnection.

name: Page of Cups Reversed
description: The fish slips back into the cup, and the Page looks away. The reversal points to emotional immaturity, broken trust, or repressed creative intuition.

name: Knight of Cups Reversed
description: The romantic knightâ€™s charm becomes fickle and insincere. His cup spills as dreams give way to disillusionment or emotional inconsistency.

name: Queen of Cups Reversed
description: The Queenâ€™s reflective cup is clouded. Her nurturing energy turns inward or distorted, signaling insecurity, emotional overwhelm, or dependence on othersâ€™ approval.

name: King of Cups Reversed
description: The Kingâ€™s steady throne rocks amid stormy seas. His calm facade hides volatility or emotional control used for self-interest rather than compassion.
